properties.comment: This configuration describes the names of buttons and menu items in base graphical user interfaces. To change the configuration note that the key is the same as the enum type in BaseFrame.BaseAction and the given value consists of the actual short name and - separated by a semicolon ";" the corresponding tool tip.
properties.entry: Selects all available components for the plot.
Selects all compartments for the plot.
If this option is selected, all species of the model are plotted.
With this option you can plot the changes of all global parameters in the model.
Select this option to plot the evolution of all flux values in the model.
Select the components to be shown in the plot.
Select the components to be excluded from the plot.
Cannot read this format, because no column identifiers are provided.
The data file contains some elements that do not have a counterpart in the given model. These elements will not occur in the plot and are ignored in the analysis.
Decide whether or not by default all compartments in a model should be considered the target of an optimization, i.e., value estimation.
Decide whether or not by default all global parameters in a model should be considered the target of an optimization, i.e., value estimation.
Decide whether or not by default all local parameters in a model should be considered the target of an optimization, i.e., value estimation.
Decide whether or not by default all species in a model should be considered the target of an optimization, i.e., value estimation.
The maximal value of the initialization range in a parameter estimation procedure.
The minimal value of the initialization range in a parameter estimation procedure.
The maximal value in the absolute allowable range in a parameter estimation procedure.
The minimal value in the absolute allowable range in a parameter estimation procedure.

Decide whether a model calibration should be done using multiple shoot technique. This should be the default. The other possibility is the so-called single shoot technique. This means that only one initial value is taken to integrate the ordinary differential equation system, whereas the multiple shoot technique restarts the integration in each time step given the values in this step. The aim is then to come as close as possible to the start value in the next time step. In many cases the fitness landscape becomes much more friendly when using a multiple shoot strategy.
Fit the system to spline interpolations.

If this is selected, splines will be calculated from given experimental data and the parameter estimation procedure will fit the system to the splines instead of the original values. The advantage of this procedure is that the amount of available data is increased due to this form of interpolation, also ensuring that the shape of the resulting curves comes close to what could be expected. The disadvantage is that the influence of potential outliers on the overall fitness is increased.
This defines the number of additional spline sampling points between the measurement data. If you select zero, only the real sampling points will be used.
These options allow you to estimate parameters with respect to spline interpolation values between given measurement data and to configure how to calculate these splines.
Define the initial and absolute ranges of all optimization targets.
Evaluation criteria for the model's quality
This specifies the class name of the default quality function that evaluates the quality of a simulation with respect to given (experimental) data.
The default return value of a quality function that can be used if for some reason a quality cannot be computed. For example, this might avoid a division by zero.

The root parameter in the distance function for n-metrics: in case of the n-norm this is at the same time also the exponent. For instance, the Eulidean distance has a root value of two, whereas the Manhattan norm has a root of one. In the RSE, the default root is also two, but this value may be changed.
Here you can specify how to evaluate the quality of a parameter set with respect to given experimental data.
Select whether or not to apply a multiple shooting strategy.
Set the constraint J*G less than 0 on
Set the constraint |J| - r_max*|G| less than 0 on
Set the constraint J greater than 0 on
Set the constraint to compute the error on
The default target function is always flux minimization
A double value required to weight the concentrations
A double value required to weight the errors
A double value required to weight the L-matrix
A double value required to weight the computed Gibbs energies
Load a concentration file for FBA
Load a Gibbs file for FBA
Load a system boundaries file for FBA
Requires a number of iterations for the CPLEX algorithm
Result of the best individual per generation of the model simulation
Cannot estimate the values of quantities that are not part of the given model.
At least for one symbol reference data are required.
Sets all values to the original values from the model. However, previously undefined values will be set to the default values.
{0} for {1} {2} replaced by the corresponding default value {3,number}:
Occurs in the kinetic law of reaction: {0}
The default save directory for graphics files as a result of a plot.
The background color of the plot
The color of the plot's grid
Set the title of the plot
Decide whether or not to draw a grid in the plot area.
Add or remove a legend in the plot.
Let the plot display tool tips for each curve.
Options for the visible rectangle of the plot panel
Options for appearance of the plot area
Row index {0} out of bounds: {1} rows available.
Column index {0} out of bounds: {1} columns available.
Cannot adopt the new value {0,number} because it {4} the current {3} of {1,number}.
Cannot change the derived unit of {0}.
Check this box to include {0} {1} in the optimization
Please select the model components, whose values are to be optimized. You can also change the allowable ranges for each element.
Select the absolute {0} allowable value for this {1} named {2}.
Select the {0} allowable value for this {1} named {2} in the initialization.
In this tab you can select the {0} in the model whose values are to be optimized.
With this button you can easily select all elements on this panel
With this button you can easily deselect all elements on this panel.
No simulation running that could be canceled.
If not specified the value corresponding to this argument will be used to initialize the size of compartments.
If not specified the value corresponding to this argument will be used to initialize species depending on their hasOnlySubstanceUnits property as initial amount or initial concentration.
The default initial value that is set for parameters with undefined value.

Decide how to treat the values of compartments, species, and parameters if no initial value has been defined in the model. A missing initial value is to be distinguished from invalid, i.e., NaN, values. Furthermore, the elements may have very diverse the units associated with them. Here it is only possible to define one numeric value for each element group, irrespective of any unit.

This gives the class name of the default solver for Ordinary Differential Equation (ODE) systems. The associated class must implement AbstractDESSolver and must have a constructor without any parameters.

The double value associated with this key must, in case of SBML equal to zero. Generally, any start time would be possible. This is why this key exists. But SBML is defined to start its simulation at the time zero.
With the associated non-negative double number that has to be greater than 0 when simulating SBML models, it is possible to perform a simulation.
The greater this value the longer the computation time, but the more accurate will be the result.
Here you can specify parameters for the simulation of the model.
Could not find any solvers for differential equation systems. A simulation is therefore not possible.
No simulation has been performed yet. Please run the simulation first.
Currently, no experimental data have been opened, nor modified. There is nothing to be saved at the moment.

The number of time points between the start and the end time of the simulation at which the numerical integration routine should solve the differential equation system. The number of integration steps determines the step size of the integration that equally divides the entire time interval into smaller sub-intervals.
Cannot change to logarithmic scale because at least one value on the y-axis is not greater than zero.
Simulation not possible because the model is unstable. Please try again with a different solver.
These options are used to select all input files for the simulation.
Select output files for the results of simulation and parameter estimation.
Select a model in SBML format that is to be simulated.
Select a file where to store the model in SBML format after parameter optimization.
Select a file where to store the results of a simulation.
Path to a file with a time series of species/compartment/parameter values.
Can only open one model, rejecting the following files:

The optimization tool box EvA2 cannot be launched. This problem occurs whenever this program cannot determine its own location on your local computer. This happens, for instance, if you have started SBMLsimulator as a Java™ Web Start application. In order to be able to invoke any model calibration method, please download the entire program SBMLsimulator and run it locally, e.g., by double clicking on the JAR file. Please have a look into the online help of SBMLsimulator where you can find a direct link to the project's homepage.
Cannot open data if no model has been opened.
The current model must be closed before a new model can be opened.
Close current model and all data without saving?
Could not open the following files:
Close model;Closes the currently selected model and all experimental data sets that may be associated with the model.
Open model;Open a model in SBML format for simulation or parameter optimization.
There is nothing to be saved at the moment.
Open a model or experimental data.
Open one ore multiple experimental data sets.
Launch the optimization of the quantities in the current model, i.e., fits the model to given experimental data.
Opens a dialog to print the plot image.
Decide whether or not to display the options.
Performs a dynamic simulation run with the current settings.
